p: Mg(AlH 4) 2 has a hydrogen content of 9.3 wt.%; however, dehydrogenation studies report values in the range of 6–7 wt.% in the first dehydrogenation step [ 196]. The most accepted dehydrogenation pathway assumes that Mg(AlH 4) 2 decomposes in the temperature range of 110–200 °C, according to the reaction [ 196, 197]: Mg(AlH 4) 2 →MgH 2 + 2Al + 3H 2. (42)
